comment: Does not know what he does and does not give any feedback, rarely responds to emails, the only reason why he responded was because he was pressured to. IT and SWE majors if you're going to take this class, take it with Sturisky if he teaches.

If you're taking 3633, make sure you get access to the book. Slides alone won't be enough to prepare for the tests. Don't miss deadlines on assignments/discussions, they can balance out the brutal test grades. Pick another instructor that will be more respectful of the time and money spent on this course and a better investment in your education.
Does not know what he is doing and half the time gives feedback that is not going to improve your life.
If you care about your gpa you would not take this class.

Terrible professor, not recommended, avoid if possible. There are lecture slides and textbook readings barely corresponding to weekly discussions and assignments. Seems like the course itself was taken from another professor. There is only one extra credit opportunity worth 1% of total grade. Midterm and final are brutual open ended questions.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Not a great professor. Be mindful of the fact that he is not true to his word. Would never take again.
He just does not enjoy life. He would review ur stuff before submitting it but then give you feedback that wont increasingly improve your grade. Makes lectures boring asl, idek he just not it.

If you are taking this professor, do not make any mistakes and double check everything you turn in. My WiFi cut out in the middle of a quiz and I emailed him multiple times right after it happened, but he gave me a 20%. He said I should have been somewhere with good wifi and couldn't retake the quiz since I may have already seen the questions.Awful
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: The grades received are inconsistent, the same level of work on one lab may result in an A or C. Unlike what another reviewer said he IS NOT lenient on late work. I asked for a late submission (for the first time) and he told me flat out No. He does not teach the course, you watch youtube videos and have to figure out the rest for yourself.

Poor form of communication and understanding of assignments. Not clear and the syllabus says one thing while meaning something completely different, or just straight up doesn't mention any information. Class is easy, but you can easily fail if you don't know what you're doing, professor doesn't help either. Poor communication and understanding.

As opposed to other reviews, I had a great experience taking a class with Professor Obotette. He is very friendly and caring. He may be slower to respond to some emails, but was very forgiving when it came to late work and poor performance. For an online class, as long as you practice you will easily pass. I would personally recommend this class.

As the previous one below said, do not get him. Awful person. You will be in a catastrophic situation. A lot of problems. Barely grading criteria. No clear assignments. Just, run away from him. Get someone else or another school. That is not a human. You will work your back off and you will barely get 50 %. You are still thinking..run away..

This professor does not understand the meaning of explicit instruction, feedback that is given on assignments is too condensed to be understood or be beneficial to your next assignment. Does not care if you're a full time student and employee. Tells you "God bless you" when you ask to resubmit an assignment because you submitted the wrong thing.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things
